TITLE: Connecting to a Bitcoin Node via SOCKS5 Proxy
DESCRIPTION: C# code demonstrating how to connect to a Bitcoin node using a SOCKS5 proxy (e.g., Tor) with NBitcoin. It sets up connection parameters and initiates a version handshake.
SOURCE: https://github.com/metacosa/nbitcoin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
var connectionParameters = new NodeConnectionParameters();
connectionParameters.TemplateBehaviors.Add(new SocksSettingsBehavior(Utils.ParseEndpoint("localhost", 9050)));
Node node = await Node.ConnectAsync(Network.Main, "7xnmrhmkvptbcvpl.onion:8333", connectionParameters);
node.VersionHandshake();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic NBitcoin Usage Example in C#
DESCRIPTION: A simple C# program demonstrating how to generate a Bitcoin key and display its WIF (Wallet Import Format) representation on the Main network. This showcases the clean object-oriented API of NBitcoin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/metacosa/nbitcoin/blob/master/docs/api/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
using System;
using NBitcoin;

namespace _125350929
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            Console.WriteLine("Hello World! " + new Key().GetWif(Network.Main));
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Creating and Synchronizing Bitcoin Nodes with NBitcoin.TestFramework in C#
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to create two Bitcoin nodes, start them, generate blocks on one node, and synchronize them. The code also verifies that both nodes have the same best block hash after synchronization, confirming they are in sync.
SOURCE: https://github.com/metacosa/nbitcoin/blob/master/NBitcoin.TestFramework/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
using(var builder = NodeBuilder.Create())
{
	var node1 = builder.CreateNode();
	var node2 = builder.CreateNode();
	builder.StartAll();
	node2.Generate(50);
	node2.Sync(node1);

	var bestblock1 = node1.CreateRPCClient().GetBestBlockHash();
	var bestblock2 = node2.CreateRPCClient().GetBestBlockHash();
	Assert.Equal(bestblock1, bestblock2);
}
```

TITLE: Setting up NBitcoin in .NET Core Projects

```
using System;
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/metacosa/nbitcoin/blob/master/NBitcoin.Altcoins/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
public static NodeBuilder Create([CallerMemberName] string caller = null)
{
	return NodeBuilder.Create(NodeDownloadData.Litecoin.v0_15_1, Altcoins.AltNetworkSets.Litecoin.Regtest, caller);
}
```

TITLE: Generating Flamegraph for NBitcoin Benchmarks using PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command runs a specific benchmark (GolombRiceFilters in this example) and generates a flamegraph using ETW profiler. It specifies the runtime as netcoreapp2.1 and runs in Release configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/metacosa/nbitcoin/blob/master/NBitcoin.Bench/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
dotnet run -c Release -- --runtimes netcoreapp2.1 --filter *GolombRiceFilters* --profiler ETW
```

TITLE: Installing NBitcoin.TestFramework via NuGet Package Manager in C#
DESCRIPTION: NuGet command for installing the NBitcoin.TestFramework package in a .NET project. This package provides the Bitcoin node testing functionality shown in the example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/metacosa/nbitcoin/blob/master/NBitcoin.TestFramework/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
Install-Package NBitcoin.TestFramework
```
